FP000001.title: Advanced Fitness System
FP000001.description:
Efficient 4-day training split targeting each major muscle group twice per week.

This 14-week upper/lower split features 4 weekly sessions (2 upper body and 2 lower body), perfect for Novice, Beginner, Intermediate lifters focusing on General Fitness.

Exercise selection focuses on fundamental movement patterns that develop overall fitness, with a balanced approach to strength and conditioning. 

Program features include progressive overload mechanisms.

Weekly Schedule:
Monday: Upper Body
Tuesday: Lower Body
Thursday: Upper Body
Friday: Lower Body
FP000001.exercise_guidance:
## Exercise Guidance

### Volume Guidelines
- Sets per exercise: 3-5
- Repetition range: 6-12
- Rest between sets: 90-150 seconds

### Recommended Exercises
#### Upper Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Barbell Bench Press (Chest)
- Cable Rows (Back)

**Isolation Movements:**
- Cable Flyes (Chest)
- Chest-Supported Rows (Back)
- Cable Lateral Raises (Shoulders)
- Overhead Press (Shoulders)
- Dips (Arms)
- Skull Crushers (Arms)

#### Lower Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Barbell Squats
- Leg Extensions

**Isolation Movements:**
- Hack Squats
- Seated Calf Raises
- Decline Sit-Ups (Core)
- Hanging Leg Raises (Core)

### Progression Guidelines
- Use double progression: first increase reps, then increase weight
- Consider periodized approaches to break through plateaus
- Implement deload weeks every 4-6 weeks to manage fatigue

FP000002.title: Explosive Development Training
FP000002.description:
Specialized program alternating between heavy compound lifts and higher-rep hypertrophy work.

This 4-week PHUL program combines strength and hypertrophy training over 4 weekly sessions, with 2 power days followed by 2 hypertrophy days. Suitable for Beginner, Novice, Intermediate trainees looking to improve Bodybuilding.

Exercise selection focuses on a mix of compound and isolation movements with emphasis on mind-muscle connection and targeted volume for maximum hypertrophy. 

Program features include periodized intensity and volume, strategic deloads, supersets for efficiency.

Weekly Schedule:
Monday: Upper Power
Wednesday: Lower Power
Friday: Upper Hypertrophy
Saturday: Lower Hypertrophy
FP000002.exercise_guidance:
## Exercise Guidance

### Volume Guidelines
- Sets per exercise: 3-5
- Repetition range: 8-12
- Rest between sets: 90-150 seconds

### Recommended Exercises
#### Upper Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Dumbbell Bench Press (Chest)
- Bent-Over T-Raises (Back)

**Isolation Movements:**
- Push-Ups (weighted) (Chest)
- Dumbbell Shrugs (Back)
- Front Raises (Shoulders)
- Lateral Raises (Shoulders)
- Concentration Curls (Arms)
- Diamond Push-Ups (Arms)

#### Lower Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Dumbbell Lunges
- Dumbbell Step-Ups

**Isolation Movements:**
- Dumbbell Sumo Squats
- Dumbbell Romanian Deadlifts
- Dumbbell V-Sits (Core)
- Renegade Rows (Core)

### Progression Guidelines
- Use double progression: first increase reps, then increase weight
- Consider periodized approaches to break through plateaus
- Implement deload weeks every 4-6 weeks to manage fatigue

FP000003.title: EliteLift
FP000003.description:
Structured 4-day split focusing on strength for upper/lower followed by hypertrophy for upper/lower.

This 8-week PHUL program combines strength and hypertrophy training over 4 weekly sessions, with 2 power days followed by 2 hypertrophy days. Suitable for Novice, Intermediate, Advanced trainees looking to improve Powerlifting.

Exercise selection focuses on key compound movements (squat, bench press, deadlift) with proper accessory work to build maximum strength and power. 

Program features include supersets for efficiency, drop sets for muscle fatigue, tempo variations, autoregulation guidelines.

Weekly Schedule:
Monday: Upper Power
Wednesday: Lower Power
Friday: Upper Hypertrophy
Saturday: Lower Hypertrophy
FP000003.exercise_guidance:
## Exercise Guidance

### Volume Guidelines
- Sets per exercise: 4-6
- Repetition range: 1-5
- Rest between sets: 120-180 seconds

### Intensity Guidelines
- Main compound lifts: 80-95% of 1RM
- Focus on progressive overload by increasing weight or reps each week

### Recommended Exercises
#### Upper Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Incline Dumbbell Press (Chest)
- Pendlay Rows (Back)

**Isolation Movements:**
- Floor Press (Chest)
- Pull-Ups (Back)
- Upright Rows (Shoulders)
- Z-Press (Shoulders)
- Hammer Curls (Arms)
- Skull Crushers (Arms)

#### Lower Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Lunges
- Barbell Squats

**Isolation Movements:**
- Goblet Squats
- Good Mornings
- GHD Sit-Ups (Core)
- Weighted Russian Twists (Core)

### Progression Guidelines
- Utilize periodization with varied intensity and volume
- Consider implementing RPE (Rate of Perceived Exertion) for autoregulation
- Plan deload weeks strategically to maximize recovery
- Consider specialized techniques like drop sets, rest-pause, or mechanical drop sets

### Volume Guidelines
- Sets per exercise: 3-4

- Main compound lifts: 70-80% of 1RM
- Focus on progressive overload by increasing weight or reps each week

**Chest:**

- Landmine Press
- Incline Dumbbell Press

**Back:**
- Pendlay Rows
- Barbell Deadlifts
- Pull-Ups

**Shoulders:**

- Rear Delt Flyes
- Seated Dumbbell Press

**Arms:**

- Barbell Curls
- Close-Grip Bench Press

**Legs:**

- Goblet Squats
- Lunges

**Core:**

- Ab Rollouts
- GHD Sit-Ups

- Implement progressive overload by adding weight, reps, or sets
- For main lifts, add 5-10 lbs when you can complete all prescribed reps
- For accessory lifts, add 2.5-5 lbs when you can complete upper rep range

Program features include progressive overload mechanisms, strategic deloads, drop sets for muscle fatigue, rest-pause techniques.

Friday: Training
Sunday: Training
FP001310.exercise_guidance:
## Exercise Guidance

### Volume Guidelines
- Sets per exercise: 2-3
- Repetition range: 10-15
- Rest between sets: 60-90 seconds

### Recommended Exercises
#### Full Body Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Dumbbell Thrusters
- Dumbbell Shoulder Press
- Renegade Rows
- Dumbbell Rows

**Isolation Movements:**
- Push-Ups (weighted) (Chest)
- Bent-Over Y-Raises (Back)
- Lateral Raises (Shoulders)
- Bulgarian Split Squats (Legs)
- Concentration Curls (Arms)
- Dumbbell Side Bends (Core)

### Progression Guidelines
- Add weight when you can complete all sets at the upper rep range with good form
- Aim to increase weights by 2.5-5% every 1-2 weeks
- Focus on proper form and technique before adding weight

FP001314.title: PowerBuild 2.0

High-volume PPL program hitting each muscle group twice weekly for maximum hypertrophy.

This 8-week PPL program involves 6 weekly sessions (2 push, 2 pull, and 2 leg days), ideal for Intermediate trainees pursuing Powerbuilding.

Exercise selection focuses on heavy compound lifts for strength development combined with strategic isolation work for balanced muscle development and aesthetics. 

Program features include progressive overload mechanisms, periodized intensity and volume, strategic deloads.

### Volume Guidelines
- Sets per exercise: 3-5
- Repetition range: 6-12
- Rest between sets: 90-150 seconds

### Intensity Guidelines
- Main compound lifts: 70-85% of 1RM
- Focus on progressive overload by increasing weight or reps each week

### Recommended Exercises
#### Push Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Dumbbell Bench Press (Chest)
- Y-Presses (Shoulders)

**Isolation Movements:**
- Hex Press (Chest)
- Dumbbell Flyes (Chest)
- Arnold Press (Shoulders)
- Tricep Kickbacks (Triceps)
- Diamond Push-Ups (Triceps)

#### Pull Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Dumbbell Rows
- Dumbbell Deadlifts

**Isolation Movements:**
- Bent-Over Y-Raises (Back)
- Dumbbell Curls (Biceps)
- Cross-Body Curls (Biceps)
- Rear Delt Flyes (Rear Delts)

#### Legs Day
**Compound Movements:**
- Goblet Squats
- Dumbbell Calf Raises

**Isolation Movements:**
- Dumbbell Lunges
- Bulgarian Split Squats
- Weighted Crunches (Core)
- Dumbbell Side Bends (Core)

### Progression Guidelines
- Use double progression: first increase reps, then increase weight
- Consider periodized approaches to break through plateaus
- Implement deload weeks every 4-6 weeks to manage fatigue
